intro: Trichera salcedii, commonly known as the Salcedi's trichera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Trichera salcedii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
